text: Pour from a 12 oz bottle. Medium gold brew with white head. A little cloudy. Good lacing. Aroma of malt, noble hops, hints of spice and crisp fruit. Taste is a fine clean but light maltiness with a very well balanced hops finish. As per the style, taste is not extreme but is clean and well balanced. No hints of corn or rice, and quality hops. A really excellent brew.

(12oz bottle courtesy of BBB63).  Pours hazy dark yellow with white head.   Active carbonation.  Aroma of wood, florals, and honey.  Taste is sweet with a little hop bitterness at the end.  Medium bodied with an oily texture.  Finish is bitter, but not over done.  As it warms, I get more honey and some ripe melon with a bit of citrus in the hops. This is a pretty nice beer.  I would probably search this out if it were available locally.

bottle.  pours a clear yellow with a small white head.  notes of grass, hay, toast.  some sweet caramelly bread.   crisp.  good beer.  an herbal hop, toasted grainy bread pilsneresque beer.  refreshing.
12 ounce bottle a golden pour -lots of head-taste crisp clean sweet nice lager will drink again
Sample at city wide in S. Bend. Hazy copper pour fluffy off white head and spotty lace..  Light citrus and grassy notes.  Dry lemongrass finish

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2009 Wow a lager I actually enjoyed for a change.  Slightly cloudy pour with a small head.  Yeasty and citrus hit the nose.  The flavor is tart, refreshing and almost a bit funky.  Very interesting take on a worn out boring style.  Cheers.
A very nice change of pace.  Sweet bready notes with some herbal hoppiness.  Light to medium bodied and very well balanced.  Very clean with a bitter citrusy finish.
Pours a hazy copper with a generous white head.  Smells lightly citrussy with some nice straw and hay elements.  Tastes tangy and lemony with a lot of grassy notes.  Nice dry finish.

Bottle thanks to Mike!  Poured clear, brighter golden with a tall, foamy cap of off-white head.  The aroma picked up soft, sweet bready notes accented by pinches of grassy hops and lemon zest.. well-balanced and well-presented.  The flavor had a sweet biscuit and pale malty backing with high levels of herbal bitterness and the aforementioned lemon zest.. the spicy, tart finish was very refreshing.  Lighter-bodied, well-balanced, and refreshing.  I could drink a lot of this over the summer.

12oz bottle, no date.  Clear yellow golden with an ample two finger fluffy barely off-white head, great retention.  Biscuity malts with some sugar cookie up front with a little bit of earth and zesty citrus hops in the background to keep it from getting sweet.  Unsalted saltine crackers show up after this warms minimally.  Flavor is more earthy with no sugar cookie presence--it seems to be all biscuits and saltines.  Earthy bitterness lingers in the dry finish and peaks at a 3-4 at the back corners of my tongue.  Overcarbonated--the beer just foams in my mouth and takes away from the flavor--with a medium body.  It started out great, but went downhill after the aroma.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: 12 oz bottle courtesy of BBB63. Pours a yellow golden straw color with a 2 finger white frothy head. Good amount of lacing rings my pint glass. Nose is grains & hops. Taste is grainy & biscuit like. Clean, fresh & dry mouthfeel. Finish is hoppy & bitter. Im not usually a lager guy , but this wasnt bad at all.
clear yellow color with fluffy white head.  aroma is grainy and sweet.  flvor is hoppy and grainy, and the finish is bitter.  a pretty good beer, but not a great beer.

Appearance: Pours a very slightly hazed, deep yellow body with a thin ring of white bubbles.

Smell: Lightly sweet-smelling cereal aroma with nice floral notes and a bit of pepper.

Taste: Sweet pale maltiness. Lightly floral hop flavor. Hint of pepper. Mild bitterness. Dries out toward the end but still manages to finish sweet.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: A decent, refreshing lager that paired quite well with a handful of pretzels and few chicken nuggets.

Draft sample at Fall Fest 2007. Poured copper color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good. Moderate tart citrus hoppy aroma. Medium body with soft carbonation. Medium bitter flavor with a medium  bittersweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where met with this brew.

On tap at the Backroad Fall Fest and served in a shaker.  This beer poured a clear golden color with a small, foamy white head that quickly faded away.  Some very faint lacing was left around the glass.  The aroma of the beer was made up of sweet malts and some light pine and grass.  The flavor was sweet malts, biscuit, and a mild noble hop finish.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied with light carbonation.  A very clean and well crafted beer from Backroad.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2008 Date: 04/21/2007
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, 50 More Beers on the Wall

Appearance: clear yellow, wispy white head, 
Aroma: light malt aroma, 
Flavor: tart malt flavor, lemony character, 
-------- />
Date: 02/23/2008
Mode: bottle
Source: cellar tasting
Score: 1.8 to 2.7

Appearance: hazy gold, fine off white head, bits of lace, 
Aroma: sweet grain aroma with light floral hops, 
Flavor: lots of fresh cereal flavor, touch of sweetness brings out the grains, lots of balancing earthyness, long bitter finish, 

Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20
Rating: 2.7/5.0Drinkability: 6/10
Score: *4

Nice pour, a clear golden yellow with a tall spongey head.  The aroma is sweet bready malts with apples and a light grassy bitterness.  Medium bodied.  The hoppy bitterness is slightly stronger in the flavor and a drop of lemon juice is added.  Crisp finish.  A good sessionable beer.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Porter, IN<font size=-1>

Bottle.  Aroma of pale malts and apple juice, light spice, kinda reminds me of the Czech Republic.  Clear yellow-golden with a big rocky white head.  Sweet and middlingly malty taste, light spice and fruit, light dough.  Crisp medium body.  Little citrus.  Slight acidity sets in at the end, and a little balancing bitterness just before.  Actually an enjoyable offering from this brewer, a decent little session.
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2008 Pours a straw yellow color with a white head.  Aroma is of light malts, and some peppery hops.  Flavor is of light malts and a peppery earthy hop finish.
Poured a lightly hazed light golden color with a large off-white head.  Lgiht toasty malt aroma.  Tart and mildly acidic malty flavor.  Light-medum bodied.
Quality beer.  Crisp and bold taste to liven up your taste buds...I like this beer when I eat my buffalo wings!
UPDATED: JUL 6, 2006 12 ounce bottle.  Poured pale straw color with a white head.  Aromas have a bit of adjunct and apples.  Sweet up front with straw and apples.  A bit of spice.  Refreshing.
Hazy dull beige appearance.  Light malt and apple skin nose.  The flavour is a spicy, brown bready maltiness...I get rye...lord knows from where.  A little muddy/unclean but interesting.
Bottle acquired in trade with BBB63 (thanks!). Poured a medium and cloudy amberish color with an averaged sized white head. Doughy and fruity aromas. Tastes of dough, apples, citrus and light grass.

Poured a cloudy yellow brown color with a thin, white head that left no lacing on the glass.  Aroma of  dough, grass and citrus hops, and some caramel malts.  Taste of more dough, grassy hops, and light toffee malts.

Thanks for the bottle, BBB63.  Poured a gloomy and glowing yellow/gold. Formed a perfectly even layering of head across the glass. In the aroma, a mixture of elements cross my mind such as sweet malt and a fruity hop smell that reminds me of an herbal essence shampoo scent.  Flavors i note are minor tastings of malt, caramel, honey, and a light floral serving of hops. A mellow drink that finished off buttery and easy on the palate.

bottle courtesy of bbb63, pours a pale cloudy orange color, with a thin layer of white lacing on top. aroma of sweet and malty, hints of citrusy hops, and a bit of yeast. smooth malts upfront, banana flavor coming on strong, grass late and a little bit bitterness.  a very nice helles,but the hops become a little too strong at the very end, leaving a kind of harsh lingering taste.

Bottle from BBB63 shared during the great exodus.  Clear golden colored with a nice white head. Aroma of honey and banana?? which is out of place but pleasant, could be a nose malfuntion.  Crisp, refreshing.  Excellent balance between malt and hop.  A great session beer in this style.

Bottle: Dirty dark honey, small fizzy white head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Malty aroma, somewhat musty and heavy, with a heap of dull apple cider. &nbsp Subtle, yet somewhat muddy, malt flavor, a dash of Noble hops, with the aformentioned dull flavored apple cider. &nbsp Moderate body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Light finish, lingering apple cider. &nbsp Not as crisp nor refreshing as other examples, but tiz decent. &nbsp Thanks Mike!!
Orangy color, off white head. Fruitier malts, citrusy, mild hops. Light to medium bodied. Fair.
Pours a lighter orange small white head. Aroma is of apricots and grapes. Flavor is bitter and has taste of hops, and a little fruit. A decent rep. of the style, thanks to BBB63 for this tasty brew!
Slight citrus aroma.  Fairly smooth brew, but nothing terribly exciting going on.

This is a nice sweet malty helles - malts are thick, slightly carbonated, but very smooth.  Hay and grassyness in the aroma and at the finish - nice hop presence here.  Very light citrus notes - here at the end there mingling with the sweet bready malts.  I liked this one a lot - thanks Mike!

A great Helles - If anyone ever wants to know what Tettnanger tastes like, steer them to Nothern Indiana - I procured a sixer from CityWide in Mishawaka; a pretty good little beer store. This is a super pale malty, highly yeasty rendition (slightly acidic, citric) - lots of country hay, great body, make sure to drip a few drips back into the bottle and swirl all the residual stuff back into your glass; makes the beer softer and fuller. No traditional malt sweetness; this is grassy, dandeliony. Almost to Dominion Lager and Victory Helles and Burgerbrau Wolnzacher territory; yes, its that good and Im a freak for this style. Actually, a lot like Ciscos Summer of Lager, another great one! Some quality inconsistency within the six pack, but not much.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Clear gold in color, looks very much like what a lager should.  Tangy and bitter with a decent sweetness to the malt flavor.  There is an earthy hop flavor that lingers.

Hazy golden color,small white head that managed to hang around for a decent amount of time.Nice malty lemony aroma with a decent hint at sweetness and mild hops.Nice smooth feel with a nice light malt taste light lemon and hops with a decent bitter sweet after taste.Definately could be a favorite of mine if a had access to this brew.Thanks go to BBB63 for sending another fine brew.

medium hazy golden, nice creamy and lasting white head. slight diacetyl in the aroma, otherwise great earthy hops, maybe a little lemongrass? quite sweet, and flavor is quite hoppy. quite a delicious lager...thanks to BBB63 for this!

bottle-pours a nice light copper hue with nice rocky white head.  medium carbonation.  lots of yeast floaties.  aroma of sweet sugar, hops, cut grass, hay and straw. nice malt/hop balance that comes together very nice.  This would make a great session brew-thanks to BBB63 for sending this one to NM
2004 SE Gathering: Pours a cloudy orange with a banana aroma. Flavor is light and fruity with overtones of banana. Watery texture.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2008 Fresh bottle thanks to BBB63: Pours a clear golden with a thin spotty-lacing white head.  Mildly sweet with a lager yeast presence in the aroma and some noble hops.  Decent balance of semi-sweet pale malt and earthy European hops toward a more bitter drier finish.  Too dry and bitter in the finish, hurts the drinkability.
A really smooth easy to drink lager.  Pours yellow and fizzy, with an aroma of wet grass and fruits.  Sweet hop bite in the flavor, backed up by some biscuity doughy malt flavors in the finish.

Sample glass, RateBeer Southeastern Gathering.  Nice fresh lager aroma.  Very fresh and clean taste.  Medium, creamy texture, lively carbonation.  The bottom line is: freshness makes a world of difference with lagers.

This was a nice change of pace at the Atlanta gathering after many samples of BIG beers. A lager very similar to a European pilsner. Golden appearance with a nice head. Flavor was slightly bitter. Very clean and refreshing. This would make an excellent session lager when you are in the mood for something lighter.

This hazy golden-bodied lager is topped by a thin off-white head.  Following the somewhat grassy, fruity aroma is an interesting flavor of various fruits (melon, molded peaches) and grassy hops that leave a lingering bitterness on the palate that somewhat detracts from the sweet, fruity malt characterics and perfumey nature of the otherwise light body.  Rather unique, a toned-down hop profile would benefit this lager.  Thanks Mike (BBB63) for the bottle!

vibrant golden french fry color, not much head, but far from dead.  aroma of cantaloupe or pumpkin guts, dirty kitchen towel, and a little medicinal.  not attractive at all.  watery body with soft carbonation lets the composting fruits and strange bitterness seem like punishment-- even on a thirsty tongue. like sugar water on dried grass. it may be 'off'-- or maybe I'M off --off my rocker.  i opened a saranac pale  just to be sure i wasn't imagining the whole thing.  i wasn't.  the back road is simply dank and plain.

At the brewery on tap. It had a small sized off-white head with fine-large sized bubbles. The body was uncarbonated, cloudy and the hue was yellow. The nose was malty and it had a hoppy flavor to it. The palate was smooth and it was light-medium bodied.

On tap at the brewery.  This brew poured a small head of long lasting fine to medium sized bubbles that left behind a transparent yellow colored body with no carbonation.  It had a mild malt lager type aroma with a smooth mild mouthfeel that had no bite in the finish.  The flavor was mellow with notes of mild hops.  It does go down very well and is still a quite nice beer.  A special thanks goes out to their brewmaster for his hospitality and a fine tour of the facility.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2003 Wow I get to be the 10th rater of this beer that Bigbadbear63 sent me from Indiana, Thanks Buddy!  This Millennium Lager poured a large but short-lived head atop a golden copper body. The aroma is Very fresh and crisp, What is that implausible smell???? Maybe its honeysuckles and freshly baked honey cinnamon bread? Im at a loss for words with this Lager? The flavor has a big but light malty presence, not nutty but more like peaches and apples. Its a bit toasty and herbal but Peach juice notes for certain, apple cinnamon applesauce, yes thats it! I detect a nibble of the hops in the crisp finish; its delicious. I find this brew pretty complex for a Lager.  Mike, great choice, I like this one very much.

Dim golden peach.  Microscopic ring of tight bubbles.  Ale-like estery aroma coupled with hopsack, peach skin, and mineral-like aspects.  Traces of jellied malt, tea leaf, perfume, spruce, cracker, and assorted tropical fruits.  Round mouthfeel.  Still, large bubble carbonation.  Starts unusually hoppy and spicy, with round notes of star anise, almond extract, and evergreen.  The hops are met by a resilient malt backbone and a flock of esters, which keep the bitterness at bay.  The hops are borderline numbing.  Biscuity malts are here, but are continually pounced by the coarse hop textures and fruity esters.  Its got a satisfactory aroma, but hardly lagerish.  The interplay, albeit extremely subdued, of what seems to be pale and munich malts, was nice.  Its probably past its prime, but its undated.  Its not the least bit elegant, but whatever it's supposed to be, its respectable.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Had a nice chilled bottle of this at Aofoxxy's little gathering last night.  Pours a clear light golden.  The thin white fizzy head is mostly diminishing with no lacing.  The nose is grapefruit and cereal, flowers and perfume - exceptional for a lager.  The brew has excellent balance and depth for the style - almost dortmunder speed, one of the boldest lagers I've sampled to date.  The light and creamy body is soft and finishes crisp.  Once the brewers figure out how to present a head this will really be something.  A nice offering, thanks BBB.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2003 The necture of grapefruits.  Nice appearance, good looking picture perfect beer.  Rerate is spelling only!!! Obviously I drank more than I remembered at the OH mid-of-nowhere gathering.
user_location: Middle of no where, Ohio, USA

text: On tap at the Indiana Microbrewers Festival -- Golden yellow color with a fine white head and nice, clean nose.  Clean, crisp malt sweetness with a dry finish.  Good micro lager.  Why aren't the macros this good?

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2008 RERATE, Jan 2008 batch: The balance is not up to par with past releases, a bit more bitter due to the change to Hersbrucker hops. -2 Flavor, -2 Overall.  Original review: At Indiana BG Fest: Slightly different from the bottled version, it was golden hued and a bit hazy with a nice head and some lacing. The aroma hinted of toasted malts, fresh fruit, light spices, earthy grains, and vanilla. Smooth taste of malt with undertone of crisp hops and minor spices. Medium-bodied, chewy and soft mouth feel. Of all the Back Road brews this is still my favorite on a yearly basis.
Good head with sediment running throughout. Nice aroma with a hint of fruit. A solid lager with a little more sweetness than most
Nice frothy head. Quite sedimenty for a lager. Aroma of apples. Malt is thin with a slightly fruity/spicy flavor. Moderate hop character. Overall an impressive lager with some substance in the malt.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2003 Was given to me as a gift, and although it has been warm for a few days prior to drinking, it was quite good when chilled. Little head, slightly opaque. First taste is like a pale ale, then slightly sweeter.  Thanks for bbb63 for this one!

Pretty wild - yeasty, orangey flavors surface through the more traditionally beery ones in this lager.  I started out disliking it, but I really warmed to it and ended up thinking it the best of the trio of Backroad products I brought back from Indiana.  This brewery is interesting, with seriously hard to classify brews.  Their Pale (Backroad Ale) is decidely unAmerican, their amber (Maple City) tastes a lot like my homebrewed Alt, and this thing sneaks witlike tones into a big lager.  Lets take up a collection and send one of the style gurus to northern Indiana!
